## TileOffsetUtils.extractOffsetAndMortonKeyFromKey() function

Extracts the offset and morton key from the given key (must be created by: \[\[getKeyForTileKeyAndOffset\]\])

Note, we can't use bitshift operators in Javascript because they work on 32-bit integers, and would truncate the numbers, hence using powers of two.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
function extractOffsetAndMortonKeyFromKey(key: number, bitshift?: number): {
        offset: number;
        mortonCode: number;
    };
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  key | number | Key to extract offset and morton key. |
|  bitshift | number | How many bits to shift by, must be the same as was used when creating the key. |

<b>Returns:</b>

{ offset: number; mortonCode: number; }
